comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: This must be low tide. See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Chepstow_Bridge_with_a_very_hi... for a view at an abnormally high tide.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Some of these captions say Chepstow, England and others say Chepstow, Wales. The town of Chepstow is in Wales. The border is the Wye River. In this view, I think the right-hand bank is in Monmouthshire, Wales, showing part of Chepstow Castle, and the left-hand bank is Gloucestershire, England. A recent, somewhat closer, view is at www.pbase.com/paulthedane/image/4584666

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Dark room daze: Thanks for the identification of the River Wye.  Swanq:  We will fix the captions that say England, and change them to Wales.  Thanks for the good catch.
